channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11394] Replication can have data loss if peer id contains hyphen "-"
item.description:
This is an extension to HBASE-8207. It seems that there is no check for the peer id string (which is the short name for the replication peer) format. So in case a peer id containing "-", it will cause data loss silently on server failure.

I did not verify the claim via testing though, this is just purely from reading the code.
item.summary: Replication can have data loss if peer id contains hyphen "-"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I have the same doubt. We have added a restriction to the peer-id name in our private version.
Do you have a patch? It should be easy to just do a check in addPeer().
No progress on issue. Unscheduling from < 0.99. Should a patch show up we can target the latest 0.98 SNAPSHOT.

Hi Enis Soztutar,

I add a control into addPeer method of ReplicationPeersZKImpl. BTW I fixed tests in TestReplicationTrackerZKImpl and added a Peer Name Control Test. Is this enoug for the issue ?
Patch looks good to me. Trying against hadoopqa.
